summary: A digital library and reading platform where authors can upload books and users can discover, read, and download them, focused on intellectual growth, philosophy, literature, and knowledge sharing
architectural_notes: Mobile-first responsive design approach for all pages
Admin approval workflow for book uploads
PDF storage and rendering system for in-browser reading
Bookmark and progress tracking per user per book
Blue, gold, white color scheme with dark mode support
Navigation: Home, Genres, Browse, Upload, Profile, About

existing_features.title: Implement mobile-first responsive design for Navigation component with hamburger menu that appears on screens smaller than 768px (md breakpoint). The hamburger icon should toggle a mobile menu overlay with touch-friendly spacing and all navigation items.

Make all interactive elements (buttons, links, form inputs) touch-friendly with minimum 44x44px touch targets and adequate spacing (minimum 8px) between adjacent interactive elements on mobile devices.
Ensure HomePage/LandingPage displays responsively with properly scaled background, centered content, and readable text on all screen sizes from 320px width upward.

Make PersonalizedHomePage fully responsive with stacked layout on mobile: recommendations, continue reading, recently viewed, trending sections, and mood carousels should stack vertically and display properly on screens down to 320px width.

Make BrowseBooksPage responsive with mobile-optimized genre/author filter dropdowns, mood chips that wrap on small screens, and a book grid that displays 1 column on mobile (<640px), 2 columns on tablets (640-1024px), and 3+ columns on desktop.

Make BookDetailPage fully responsive with stacked layout on mobile: book cover, title, author, rating, description, and PDF viewer should stack vertically. PDF viewer should resize to fit mobile screen width while maintaining usability.
Optimize all carousel components (BookCarousel, MoodCarousel) for touch gestures with swipe support, properly sized navigation arrows for mobile, and smooth horizontal scrolling.

Ensure all text content uses responsive font sizes: headings should scale down appropriately on mobile while remaining readable (minimum 16px for body text, 20px for h3, 24px for h2, 32px for h1 on mobile).

Ensure all images (book covers, backgrounds, author avatars) use responsive sizing with proper aspect ratios, CSS object-fit properties, and loading states. Images should never distort or break layout on any screen size.

Make Sidebar component responsive: show full sidebar on desktop (â‰¥1024px), auto-collapse on tablets (768-1024px), and hide completely on mobile (<768px) with functionality moved to Navigation hamburger menu.
Verify and test that all existing features (bookmarking, rating, progress tracking, authentication, file uploads) function correctly on mobile devices with touch input and mobile browsers.

Maintain consistent Van Gogh-inspired color scheme (blue, gold, white), typography, spacing, and design patterns across all screen sizes to ensure visual uniformity and professional appearance on mobile, tablet, and desktop.

new_feature_requests.summary: Book browsing by genres and categories with advanced search
Book upload system for authors with title, description, genre, cover, and PDF
In-browser PDF reader with page navigation
Admin approval system for uploaded books
Fully responsive mobile-first design with hamburger menu and touch-friendly elements
Make UploadBookPage responsive with single-column form layout on mobile, touch-friendly file upload areas, and properly sized input fields. BookForm dialog should adapt to mobile screen sizes.

Make ProfilePage and AuthorDashboardPage responsive with stacked layouts on mobile. Dashboard tabs should scroll horizontally or convert to dropdown on small screens. Statistics cards should display in 1-2 column grid on mobile.
Make AdminPage and AdminReviewPage responsive with stacked book cards or list view on mobile, touch-friendly action buttons, and accessible dialogs that fit mobile screens.

Ensure all modal dialogs (BookForm, EditProfileDialog, DeleteAccountModal, AuthPrompt, ProfileSetupModal, etc.) are responsive and fit mobile screens with appropriate padding, scrollable content when needed, and touch-friendly close buttons.

Add responsive breakpoints to Tailwind config and update all components to use responsive utility classes (sm:, md:, lg:, xl:) for layout, spacing, typography, and visibility following mobile-first approach.
